comments: Coordination sequence for infinite tree with valency 11.a(n) is sequence A003945(n-1) written in base 2: a(0)= 1, a(n) for n >= 1: 2 times 1, (n-1) times 0. a(n) is also A007283(n-1) and A042950(n) for n >= 1 written in base 2. a(n) is also A098011(n+3) and A101229(n+10) for n >= 1 written in base 2. a(n) is also Abs(A110164(n+1)) for n >= 1 written in base 2. - _Jaroslav Krizek_, Aug 17 2009For n>=1, a(n) equals the numbers of words of length n-1 on alphabet {0,1,...,10} with no two adjacent letters identical. - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 31 2015
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 312
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (10).
Index entries for sequences related to trees
formula: a(n) = Sum_{ 0<=k<=n } A029653(n, k)*x^k for x = 9. - _Philippe DelÃ©ham_, Jul 10 2005G.f.: (1+x)/(1-10x). - _Paul Barry_, Mar 22 2006a(0) = 1, a(n) = 10^n + 10^(n-1) = 11*10^(n-1) for n >= 1. - _Jaroslav Krizek_, Aug 17 2009
maple: k := 11; if n = 0 then 1 else k*(k-1)^(n-1); fi;
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 04 2009
